title: Sakalava people
summary: The Sakalava are an ethnic group of Madagascar.[2] They are found on the western and northwest region of the island, in a band along the coast. The Sakalava are one of the smaller ethnic groups, constituting about 6.2 percent of the total population,[3] that is over 1,210,000 in 2014.[4] Their name means "people of the long valleys." They occupy the western edge of the island from Toliara in the south to Sambirano in the north.
